medical_history.chief_complaint: A 10-year-old girl presented with fever, right-sided frontal headache, abdominal pain, vomiting, lethargy, photophobia, and gaze deviation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days prior to admission, starting with fever and headache, progressively leading to lethargy, photophobia, and right gaze deviation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of wild-type varicella-zoster virus infection 3 years earlier and intermittent cold sores. No previous surgeries or significant medical conditions.
medical_history.family_history: A 3-year-old sibling had a resolving febrile illness with no localizing signs coinciding with the patient's symptom onset.
